title.narrative: She Leads EA 21-25: Advancing GYW rights to meaningful participation and engagement in regional decision making spaces.

description.narrative: While African WROs do  recognize the specific oppressions that the girl-child faces, the voices of GYW have hardly been integrated in a meaningful manner in the women’s rights movement, nor adequately represented in the regional decision making spaces. This is partly because WROs assume that they represent all female interests, and also the fact that most GYW lack the capacity to access relevant platforms. This is a reflection of the effects of negative cultural norms, lack of resources, and inadequate strategies to meaningfully engage them.

title.narrative: Advocate for girls' access to regional and international institutions and human rights mechanisms. Girls access the regional and international institutions and human rights mechanisms.

description.narrative: Advocate for girls' access to regional and international institutions and human rights mechanisms. Girls access the regional and international institutions and human rights mechanisms.

title.narrative: Number of regional bodies and institutions who respond to and support the GYW's advocacy asks.

description.narrative: Number of regional bodies and institutions who respond to and support the GYW's advocacy asks.

comment.narrative:
Although the project has been introduced to the following institutions; AU, EAC, IGAD, CSO Forum, Ministry of ICT, Innovation and Youth Affairs in Kenya, NYC Uganda and the Anti FGM board Kenya. through our HoAYN networks. We have secured reginal commitment to supporting the project and providing space to amplify the voices of GYW network.
Further this is was a joint activity that was to be implemented by consortium partner FEMNET we are awaiting further guidance.;
Horn of Africa Youth Network reached out to the EAC, IGAD, ACERWC and AU to introduce the She Leads project and create spaces that will respond to and support the GYW's advocacy asks.;

IGAD supported and adopted GYW advocacy asks during the Regional Consultative Meeting on the development of the IGAD Youth Policy held in Djibouti on 15th-16th November 2021. The Consultative meeting was organized by HoAYN in partnership with IGAD. IGAD and AU also responded to GYW advocacy asks that were captured in a communique during the first ever, High-level Ministerial Summit held on 1st - 5th November in Nairobi Kenya, that was later signed and adopted by the RECs and ministers from the East and Horn of Africa Region.;

Financial Comment: This activities is budgeted for Q4. Some funds were however utilized in Q3 to implement activities mentioned above which were undertaken in Q3.;

The HoAYN mobilized and supported GYW/CSOs namely: Network of Ethiopian Women Association and Yellow movement to attend the launch of She Leads Africa Program in Niamey, Niger which was a joint activity led by FEMNET.;

comment.narrative: The HoAYN supported GYW to virtually attend the regional Girls Summit and the She Leads Regional Program launch as well as the 16 Days of activism webinar themed: 'The Road to Ending Digital Violence against GYW in Africa.';
The She leads network consists of a diverse network with representation from urban and rural areas, informal and formal settlements as well as persons with disabilities.;

title.narrative: Influencing formal decision-makers (lobbying): Relevant regional bodies and institutions engaged, respond to, and support the GYW's advocacy Asks.

description.narrative: Influencing formal decision-makers (lobbying): Relevant regional bodies and institutions engaged, respond to, and support the GYW's advocacy Asks.

title.narrative: Number of regional bodies and institutions who respond to and support the GYW's advocacy asks.

description.narrative: Number of regional bodies and institutions who respond to and support the GYW's advocacy asks.

comment.narrative: 3 Regional Economic Communities (RECÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢S) i.e. EAC, COMESA, IGAD and AU responded to GYW advocacy asks that were captured in a communique during the first ever, High-level Ministerial Summit held on 1st to 5th November in Nairobi Kenya, that was adopted by the RECs and ministers from the East and Horn of Africa Region. The conference was jointly organized by HoAYN in partnership with COMESA, AU and Save the Children to discuss the 'Role of Governments, RECs and Regional Mechanisms in Promoting the Youth, Peace & Security Agenda in the East and Horn of Africa Region.;

HoAYN mobilized girls to develop an issue paper titled COVID 19 and Sexual Reproductive Health Rights of Girls and Young Women in East Africa region, the issue paper was later submitted during the national Dialogue Forum and key asks from GYW was captured as key priority in the forum to inform the agenda of EAC SG Forum. GYW will be monitoring and follow up on the implementation of key recommendations.;

Horn of Africa Youth Network continued to engage regional bodies such as IGAD where we have positioned GYW and together with IGAD Consultant GYW have begun contributing to the drafting the IGAD Youth Policy In EAC- We are following up the implementation of the EAC Gender Policy and Its Plan of Action ACERWC and AU, we are co-hosting first ever High Level conference on the role of RECS and regional mechanisms, and governments in promoting Youth Peace and Security agenda in the East and Horn of Africa region.
Financial report comment: This budget line covered project personnel and project contribution to administrative costs;

The project has been introduced to the following institutions; AU, EAC, IGAD and CSO Forum. All the officials met committed to supporting the project and providing space to amplify the voices of GYW network. The Budget include Euros 1,365 which was meant for March 2021 personnel and Administrative costs. The project however commenced on 1st April 2021 and the March personnel and Administrative costs were not permitted.;

comment.narrative:
2 individual digital stories were published;1 Podcast and 1 radio station featured a story of GYW.
First story was by a blogger named Nairobi Feminist under the series on ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‹Å“untold lives of womenÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ featuring GYW on discussions on health https://www.podbean.com/ew/pb-qze8y-10b6a71
Second Story featured on a Kenyan radio station discussing issues around SRHR and menstural hygiene.
Financial report comment: This budget line covered project personnel and project contribution to administrative costs;

There have been two articles published in quarter one with improved attitudes towards GYW's voice and leadership. A digital media in Uganda published two articles; one was on digital safety for GYW leaders; - https://chimpreports.com/long-read-digital-insecurity-a-monster-silencing-women-on-internet-spaces/ Another article was on the 17 demands of the African Feminists and Civil Societies made during 66th CSW kick off; https://chimpreports.com/climate-change-african-feminists-civil-society-make-17-demands-as-66th-csw-kicks-off/;

title.narrative: Research and data driven advocacy: Regional study finalised and disseminated in pan African spaces.

comment.narrative: HoAYN Convened GYW Regional Consultative Forum in Ethiopia the forum was used to disseminate Research and data driven advocacy that were developed previously such as Media landscape report, Report on participation of Girls and young women in political and public decision making process at the regional level;

The project finalized a media landscape mapping report covering Kenya, Ethiopia, Uganda and Mali (Annexed) and a study on participation of GYW in the regional spaces (Annexed). The findings of the study will be disseminated in the next quarter.
The Budget that include Euro. 2,780 under activity 3.2.1 which is a joint activity to be implemented once FEMNET .provide guidance on this activity.;

title.narrative: Safeguarding: Safe involvement to the She Leads Programme is ensured for project target groups and an enabling environment is created.

description.narrative: Safeguarding: Safe involvement to the She Leads Programme is ensured for project target groups and an enabling environment is created.

title.narrative: Percentage of GYW involved in the programme who have knowledge, access to and trust in the reporting mechanisms to report safeguarding concerns

description.narrative: Percentage of GYW involved in the programme who have knowledge, access to and trust in the reporting mechanisms to report safeguarding concerns

comment.narrative: All the GYW in the She Leads network have knowledge, access to and trust in the reporting mechanisms to report safeguarding concerns.;

The HoAYN held a webinar on the 16 Days of Activism where over 12 GYW were trained on online and physical safety.
The project activities are guided by the HoAYN safeguarding policy for instance, the project supported a young girl from Uganda to participate in a High Level ministerial summit and made sure to support a chaperone to accompany her in order to guarantee her safety and security.;

comment.narrative: The HoAYN supported She Leads partner, Girl up Initiative from Uganda to participate in the 7th GIMAC Youth Advocacy Training held in Addis Ababa Ethiopia. HoAYN further mobilized 4 She Leads partners namely, Girl up Initiative, Network for Adolescent and Youth of Africa, Gender and Media Initiative Trust, Network of Ethiopian Women Association to attend and participate for 2 days training on Youth Engagement in Child Rights Advocacy in the East and Horn of Africa Region as one of the buildup activities to 20th CSO Forum;

title.narrative: Support the formation and strengthening of a social movement for girls rights and gender equality: Movement building is a key strategy to strengthen GYW voices in the regional spaces. This will be done while linking with the She Leads implementing countries in EA and Mali.

comment.narrative: The HoAYN supported a GYW advocate from Girl Up Initiative to join GIMAC Young Women Network where she got trained on regional youth advocacy training on issues of peace and security, Climate Change, Economic Empowerment and Health.;

The project mapped out Girls and Young Women who will form part of the GYW network and the larger She Leads movement from Save the Rural Girl Child , Deaf girl Rescue, Setaweet Movement, Peperusha Binti & Hijabi mentorship, who will be trained in the next quarter. The bio of the GYW is attached.;

comment.narrative: 3 GYW networks namely NEWA, Yellow Movement and Girl up Initiative Uganda have built networks with Gracie Machel young women Pan-African movement.;
The GYW in the She leads network has formed a network/movement that connects organizations in all the she leads implementation countries i.e Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia and Mali.;
